questions.question: Located in Southeast Asia, this extraordinary site is a UNESCO World Heritage location known for its Khmer architecture and was the center of the Khmer Empire from the 9th to the 15th century.
questions.context: This temple complex, the largest religious monument in the world, was originally dedicated to the Hindu god Vishnu before becoming a Buddhist temple by the end of the 12th century.

questions.question: Which historical site in Greece is known as the birthplace of the Olympic Games and features the famous Temple of Zeus?
questions.context: Held every four years beginning in 776 BC, the ancient Olympic Games were part of a religious festival that honored Zeus, king of the gods in Greek mythology.

questions.question: Famous for its opera house and harbor bridge, which city was chosen as the location for the sailing events during the 2000 Olympic Games and features a world-renowned waterfront?
questions.context: Completed in 1973, this iconic building with shell-like structures was designed by Danish architect JÃ¸rn Utzon and has become synonymous with its home city.

questions.question: Known for its crucial role in World War II, which site in France was the focal point of the D-Day landings on June 6, 1944?
questions.context: This beach was one of the five landing areas during the Allied invasion and now hosts several memorials dedicated to the soldiers who fought and died there.

questions.question: Which site marks the location where the first controlled flight by the Wright brothers took place and is commemorated by a towering monument?

answer.label: Wright Brothers National Memorial, Kill Devil Hills

questions.context: Located in North Carolina, the Wright Brothers achieved their first powered flight on December 17, 1903, an event that changed the course of aviation history.
